fields.description:
The timezone for Moscow,St Petersbur and Volgograd suppose to be GMT+3 however they are categorize as GMT+4 in Confluence.
!timezone.png!

Similarly the issue also affect Minsk as the timezone is shown as GMT+2 where in fact it suppose to be GMT+3.
fields.summary: Incorrect Timezone for Moscow,St Petersburg,Volgograd and Minsk

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35488].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When sharing a non-SSL site via share-Blueprint, favicon and images are included as http elements too. That's reasonable but unfortunately totally wrong for Servers who are running SSL.

This will cause
* Security exceptions in Browser
* non-displayed content

depends on your browser.

example: https://wiki.childno.de/x/PQCDAQ
so actually only testing with 5.44 ... will update soon, then I'll give an update if it still happens, but I'll bet it will ;/

h3. Environment
Testing in
* Chrome
* Mozilla

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Use a Confluence using HTTPS
# Create a Page in Confluence selecting the 'Share Link' blueprint
# Add a link to a page using HTTP

h3. Expected Results
The page is secure over HTTPS

h3. Actual Results
Some contents, like icons, are displayed as HTTP. Encryption errors are shown, as the page is HTTPS, but some content uses HTTP.
 
h3. Notes
This is related to so many other issues like
[project = CONF AND (text ~ "content" OR text ~ "insecure" OR text ~ "https")|https://jira.atlassian.com/issues/?jql=project%20%3D%20CONF%20AND%20(text%20~%20%22content%22%20OR%20text%20~%20%22insecure%22%20OR%20text%20~%20%22https%22)]
e.g.
* CONF-31901(Widget connector, not fixed)
* CONF-31065 (What's new, fixed in 5.5)
* CONF-31098 (youtube, fixed in 5.3.4)

c'mon ... please check ALL you widgets, crawler, etc.
seems to with 5.5. only a subset has been fixed (What's new).
It's really annoying for most business users!

h3.Workaround
*Partial workaround*
Edit the page and remove the content that is not encrypted (it will be lost)
fields.summary: Mixed Content errors when sharing non-https links via Share Blueprint

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35479].
  {panel}

We are using Confluence to generate customer facing documentation. User groups have requested me to generate a (monthly) report of all changes in space, one that does not require any extra clicks.

What we need is the style of notification that is sent after a single page modification (changes marked in the message) but then accumulated for all changes in a month. But, if I make a change myself, obviously I do not get a notification for that, so the only way around it would be to create another user and have all notifications sent to a that e-mailadres, and monthly, print out all e-mails.

I have tried the daily digest, but this only shows a page was changed, not what was changed.

I have tried the RSS feed, with the same problem.

I did not find any macro's either that work on space level.
fields.summary: Report on all changes in a space within a certain timeframe

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce :
# Login to Confluence
# Create a page
# Insert a team calendar into the page
# Ask a user A to watch the page
# Make changes to team calendar
# User A is receiving email notification for the calendar as expected
# Creator of the page restrict the page with the calendar from being viewed by the user
# Creator of the page make changes to the calendar again within the page restricted from User A
# User A is still receiving email notification for the calendar changes even though restriction have been applied to the page

Expected behavior : User A should not receive notification for the calendar from pages that have been restricted

Current behavior : User A is still receiving notification from the page with the calendar even though the page have been restricted.

Basically this happen because User A that have previously watch the page  have been restricted from it is still receiving email from the calendar updates from that restricted page.

The workaround would be to remove User A from the watcher list of the page after restricting the page which is not really ideal if you have a large amount of user watching the page.
fields.summary: user receives email notification even though restriction have been applied to the page

When the 'Create space' menu is opened by a user without permission to create a space, it displays a 'Loading' message infinitely.  It would be better if it displayed a meaningful message.

1. log into confluence as a user without permission to create either a personal or (regular) space. 
2. in the *Get Started* area of the dashboard click on 'create a new space'
3. the *create space* dialog opens, displaying the 'loading' scroll indefinitely.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35463].
  {panel}

There is a third party package available to server-based instances but nothing generally available for cloud-based users that I can find. Minimum requirements would be:
1. Ability to assign single to many approvers for a given document
2. Approval requests relayed via email to approvers
3. Ability to configure approval request to run serially (1st approver must approve before 2nd) or in parallel (Approvers can review and approve in any order)
4. Ability to assign a Due Date to approval request
5. Automatic email notification / follow up on approval tasks not completed
6. Email message included with approval request that is configurable 
7. Approval/Rejection can include a comment / note from Assignee
8. Configurable option to end the approval process if it is rejected by any participant
9. Configurable option to end the approval process if the document is changed before the process completes
10. Automatic notification to Creator when approvals have completed or been rejected
11. Document approval history available for x days/years
fields.summary: Robust Workflow process to address need for a Document Approval Tool within Confluence

Steps to reproduce
# Login to Confluence
# Create a Space and go to the Space
# Attach 1 or 2 attachment to the page
# Click edit page and add Space Attachments macro
# Add it to the page
# Hover over to the search filter on the Space attachment and press enter

Current behavior : The Space attachments macro dissapears after pressing enter
Expected behavior : The Space attachments macro should have a error message if the search query is invalid instead of dissapearing. Searching does not work as well. It just dissapears

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35451].
  {panel}

I like the task list, which is bundled with confluence. But to improve its usability I lack some features. 

I need a switch (button, checkbox, link) that hides finished tasks. I do not want to see them. It would be fine to show only open, only finished and both tasks.

Both finished and open tasks looks same, they can be distinguised only by the state of their checkboxes. So I propose to put CSS styles for finished tasks and make it by default italic/grey.

There are many other features, that would boost productivity of this feature. For example add labels to each task, filters by tasks, deadlines .. But for now I will be happy with hiding finished tasks.
fields.summary: tasklist - hide finished tasks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35450].
  {panel}

I do not currently have a way to inline equations (math) into a wiki page.

A plugin (free) exists here:
https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.latex.confluence.macro-latex

Can we get this installed or am I just not aware of how to activate it?

This is for work I'm doing on the Prime Air wiki.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Equation/Latex Editing Support

As you can see in the screenshot below, header of the space directory table lacks a (virtual) 6th cell.
It has only 4 physical while one (the first) has a colspan 2, that's virtually 5 but <tbody> contains 5 OR 6 cells (icon, name, description, categories, info and ... that's optional if you are logged in: favorites)
The latter one 'causes table is visually broken if customize CSS layout.

!Spacedirectory_missing_header_col.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
When embedding a video Multimedia macro on Confluence page, Video would not load. 
-> Not the VLC plugin issue as videos are able to load from other website using the VLC plugin

How to replicate:
1. Attach a video (*.swf, *.avi or *.mp4 to a Confluence page)
2. Add a Multimedia macro for the video
3. Video would not load

Workaround:.
# Disabling VLC Web plugin and use other Multimedia Player Web Plugin instead
#* From Chrome, disabling VLC Web Plugin can be done by going to chrome://plugins, and disable VLC Web Plugin
#* From Firefox, disabling VLC Web Plugin can be done by going to Open Menu > Add-ons > Plugins > "Never Activate" under the VLC Web Plugins
fields.summary: Multimedia Macro could not work in Confluence while using VLC plugin in Chrome and Firefox

fields.description:
Placing a full HTML page (including the doctype declaration, html and head tags) into an HTML macro breaks rendering on both the edit and view screens. h5.Steps to Reproduce * Enable the HTML macro * Add an HTML macro to a page * Insert the following HTML: {code:html} Untitled Document

Hello world

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Ut enim ad minim veniam, quis nostrud exercitation ullamco laboris nisi ut aliquip ex ea commodo consequat. Duis aute irure dolor in reprehenderit in voluptate velit esse cillum dolore eu fugiat nulla pariatur. Excepteur sint occaecat cupidatat non proident, sunt in culpa qui officia deserunt mollit anim id est laborum.

{code} * Save the page Upon viewing the page, you'll see that the footer detaches from its position and ends up underneath the body content. See screenshot {{broken_rendering}} Upon editing the page, you'll see that the edit page is seemingly missing content. See screenshot {{broken_edit_1}}. The content has actually been pushed down the page, and rendered incorrectly. See screenshot {{broken_edit_2}}. Additionally, clicking the "Edit" and "Save" buttons do nothing. Reloading the edit screen shows the screen as expected. This behavior appeared regardless of which browser I used. h5. Workaround Remove the doctype declaration and , (including anything within the ), and tags. Include only the HTML of the actual element you want to use, such as a
.
fields.summary: Using HTML tags inside the HTML macro breaks rendering on View and Edit screens

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35431].
  {panel}

Confluence database schema does not seem to follow any particular naming convention.

For some databases, such as MySQL, table names can be uppercase or lowercase, depending on the table.

The use of plural is also inconsistent. Some tables are in plural (likes, links,...) but some other are in singular (label).

This will help to be able to provide SQL queries which will work in any Confluence database, independently of the case sensitivity for the database.
fields.summary: Have a consistent naming convention for table names in the database schema

fields.description:
SEN-2534179

Please add Ho, Ce Yi <CeYi.Ho@jp.experian.com> to the ticket.

Japanese texts we enter would come out as garbled text.

We first noticed it immediately when we tried to save a page in Japanese, the page name would show up garbled. The contents (parts that are not titles nor page names), however, were displayed properly in Japanese.
So, we contented with naming the pages in English and only use Japanese in the content.

However, as time passed (when we checked back the next day or a few hours after saving the page) and when we revisited the page, even the contents ended up being garbled.
An example of this is https://confluence.cheetahmail.com/display/JC/Onboarding
In case the page is modified between now and when you read it, please refer to the screenshot at the very end of the email.

We tested this with a colleague who uses:
•	Japanese version of Windows
•	Japanese in Confluence language settings
•	Page he modified: https://confluence.cheetahmail.com/display/JC/Onboarding

…and me:
•	English version of Windows
•	“Automatically detect browser setting” in Confluence language settings, which is English
•	Last modified this page: https://confluence.cheetahmail.com/display/JC/Customer+Support

I have logged in to the page from both Google Chrome and Firefox, and they both display garbled texts as of now.
I have a feeling that this is related to how the content are encoded and stored at the backend…

What’s strange is that they were displayed properly just about after the page is saved (my colleague saved the page and I loaded it on my PC, the texts were displayed properly).
But when I reloaded the same page today, the texts became garbled again.
We have experimented with this twice. And we noticed that in both times, they were fine for a while after the page is saved, and become garbled after some time passed.
fields.summary: Japanese language not translating

fields.description:
CAC went down on 24/10, and we suspect it was because of the bandanaPersister cache being invalidate, causing all requests to issue multiple  cache gets all at the same time, drowning out the threadpool and stalling all http requests.

The BandanaPersister cache is a Near Cache, but the underlying distributed cache expires values if not access for an hour. Since the near cache is guarding these values, they will basically always expire after an hour. Depending on the traffic at that time, this may create the above situation.

The fix is to remove the expire-after-access-secs property from that particular cache.
fields.summary: BandanaPersister Underlying distributed cache should not expire

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35412].
  {panel}

When an anchor like is followed, the only indication of where the anchor is located on the page is by the browser attempting to place the anchor at the top of the viewing window. When the page is short or the viewing window is tall/wide, this won't work as the view cannot be scrolled sufficiently low. When there is a high density of anchors or multiple on the same line this may also be ambiguous (although that could be a separate issue).

Some thoughts of how to make them more visible:
- Allow anchors to have contents or provide a mechanism to label page elements
- Have anchors/elements change size/colour when they're the target of browsing (similar to comments)

Motivating reason:
Some of my users are moving documentation to our wiki and trying to use it for drafting papers. They want to have pages that contain lists/details of references and then be able to link to them where appropriate. The current solution is to use anchors, but this isn't as elegant a solution as they'd like.
fields.summary: Improve the visibility of anchors

fields.description:
If the customer try to export a workflow from Microsoft Vision as .pdf or .doc and visualise it on Confluence, the macro is not renderized.

How to reproduce:
Import the file Test_PDF.docx on Confluence and add the Office Connector Macro to visualize it, and the file will showed in gray instead of the image.

OBS　１: If the file is saved as bitmap and attached on Word and printed as .pdf, it will works well on Confluence.

OBS 2: If the workflow generated on Microsoft Visio is printed as pdf instead of exported as .pdf, then Confluence will show the pdf macro without errors.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35396].
  {panel}

Page move action requires a significant amount of insert/update/delete to the database as moving one page requires updating that page itself and all its descendant pages. This heavy procedure might cause bad user experience as they have to wait a considerable amount of time before their actions are completed. In addition, it's also the root cause of DB deadlock as it locks some tables for a quite long period of time.

Activities that slows down moving pages:
* Select/Update/Insert to CONFANCESTORS table
* Update JOURNALENTRY table
* Update links in moved pages.

Problems found with current implementation:
* CONTENTPROPERTIES is set loaded "eager" causing N+1 problem.
* Updating page's links procedure is called when pages are moved inside the same space (this heavy procedure should be skipped in this case).
* Each getAncestors() call creates one SELECT query to DB.

*Update 17/11/2015*
There is definitely some performance improvement in 5.8.6 (https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-35396?focusedCommentId=827923&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-827923) but not the order of magnitude I expected. Reopening issue because of that.
fields.summary: Page move action is too slow when moving a large number of pages

  {panel}

When viewing a Excel document which has a lot of cells, it will cause OOME due to it takes a significant amount of memory to render.

Steps to reproduce:
* Create an excel file.
* Move to the mouse to the last cell (XFD x 1048576)
* Save excel file
* Render this file cause OOME.

The default connector as written in <confluence_install>/conf/server.xml uses sslProtocol="TLS". This should only enable TLS connectors, but it also enables SSLv3. Our documentation and the included server.xml need to be updated to reflect the correct settings to enable only TLS.

Able to create unlimited excerpt-macros in a page.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35384].
  {panel}

This is a feature suggestion.

I would like the excerpt macro include settings to have an option to type a text that will link to the original exerpt-macro page.
That way the user read the exerpt and if he wants to read the whole original excerpt page he just have to click on the link below/or-above button/text

Otherwise I have to create the excerpt-include and write myself a text below it "click here for more info" and make it a link to where the exerpt is getting its content.

One problem with this is that I am using Brikit, and this link I have created does not take me to a TAB where this excerpt-macro was located.  It just takes me to the start of that page.  So I have to look to the tab where the excerpt came from.  Therefor I may think that the "link for more info" took me to the wrong content-page.

For example:

My text, My text, My text, My text, My text, My text, My text
My textMy textMy textMy textMy textMy textMy textMy text
"exerpt text here, exerpt text here, exerpt text here, exerpt text here
exerpt text hereexerpt text hereexerpt text hereexerpt text here"
click here to visit the original exerpt page

My text, My text, My text, My text, My text, My text, My text
My textMy textMy textMy textMy textMy textMy textMy text


You could have two modes for showing this text-with-link.  One located on the frame of the exerpt.  And one below-end/above-start the exerpt if no frame is used.

You could also have instead of a "text with the link" an option to just use a tiny button ( with the default-text "info" or "?" or "more").
fields.summary: Excerpt Macro show more-info-link

fields.description:
Lets say I set a excerpt macro in a page-A.  And an excerpt macro in another page-B.  So far so good.

Now I decide that that excerpt was incorrect, so I delete the excerpt macro in page-A and create a new exerpt macro in that same page but with other content.  I could also not delete the original exerpt macro but simply remove its contents and then move the excerpt macro to another area of my page A in order to put inside the excerpt macro another content.  The result in both cases is the same:

-in page-B I don´t see the changes reflected!!!!

So I delete the excerpt macro and the exerpt include and save page A and B.  Now I recreate everything again AND page-B is STILL showing the original excerpt macro I first place in page-A.

This is ridiculous.  How come nobody ever checked that if you update the contents then the exerpt insert will also reflect those changes?  The excerpt macro is basically working as a screen-shot.  Or worse.

I have Confluence 5.6.3 used in windows XP-SP2 with Firefox 33.0

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Install a version of Confluence earlier than 5 (e.g. 4.3.7)
# Verify that the schema is as follows:
{code}CREATE TABLE cwd_application_address
(
  application_id bigint NOT NULL,
  remote_address character varying(255) NOT NULL,
  remote_address_binary character varying(255),
  remote_address_mask integer NOT NULL,
  CONSTRAINT fk_application_address FOREIGN KEY (application_id)
      REFERENCES cwd_application (id) MATCH SIMPLE
      ON UPDATE NO ACTION ON DELETE NO ACTION
){code}
# Upgrade this instance to latest
# Verify that the schema hasn't changed:
{code}CREATE TABLE cwd_application_address
(
  application_id bigint NOT NULL,
  remote_address character varying(255) NOT NULL,
  remote_address_binary character varying(255),
  remote_address_mask integer NOT NULL,
  CONSTRAINT fk_application_address FOREIGN KEY (application_id)
      REFERENCES cwd_application (id) MATCH SIMPLE
      ON UPDATE NO ACTION ON DELETE NO ACTION
){code}
# Install a fresh copy of latest
# Verify the schema includes a primary key:
{code}CREATE TABLE cwd_application_address
(
  application_id bigint NOT NULL,
  remote_address character varying(255) NOT NULL,
  CONSTRAINT cwd_application_address_pkey PRIMARY KEY (application_id, remote_address),
  CONSTRAINT fk_application_address FOREIGN KEY (application_id)
      REFERENCES cwd_application (id) MATCH SIMPLE
      ON UPDATE NO ACTION ON DELETE NO ACTION
){code}
fields.summary: Primary key of cwd_application_address is not added during upgrade

fields.description:
This is how I reproduced:
# Download Confluence 5.6.3 Linux 64bit Installer from [here|http://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/downloads/binary/atlassian-confluence-5.6.3-x64.bin]
# Execute the downloaded installer
# Set custom value for HTTP and Control ports during the installation
# Confirmed the installed Confluence does not listen the customized port but the default port 8090 (this is the problem)

We can work around it by [changing the listen port after the installation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Change+listen+port+for+Confluence].
fields.summary: Cannot change listening port from installer

fields.description:
This bug only happens with Global (default) theme space. If you are using Documentation Theme it doesn't happens.

When editing a page, the page title in the editing title field is the one which was displayed before editing, not the one stored in the database. I.e. if someone has renamed the page after you displayed it, you will be using the old title, not the new one (and you will be re-saving the old title if you don't edit it).

This is an easy one to reproduce:

# in 2 different browsers (let's say, #1 and #2), display the same page
# in browser #1: Edit the page, modify the page title and Save the page
# in browser #2: don't refresh the page and Edit it
# you already see that the page title field contains the old title (although the whole page contents correctly corresponds with anything that has been previously edited, regardless of what was displayed)
# still in browser #2, make no modifications and Save the page
you've just reinstated the old page title
fields.summary: Page title not refreshed before entering Editing mode

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce
# Login to Confluence
# Create a Space
# Go to All Updates, you would see the user's profile name like the screenshot below which in the case is "almond"
!profileNameAllUpdates.jpg|thumbnail!
# Click on the profile picture on the top right corner and click Profile
# Click Edit profile
# Change the Full Name to almond2
# Go back to the All Updates tab in Confluence dashboard
!profileNameChangedAllUpdates.jpg|thumbnail!

Current behavior : the name does not change in All Updates tab. This issue even exist when new activity of the user is published on there.
Expected behavior : the name should change in All Updates tab

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35359].
  {panel}

We recently upgraded from Confluence 5.1.4 to 5.4.3 and now some of our more complex pages and templates are broken. We've isolated the issue down to the number of sub-nested macros. To recreate the issue do the following:

Create a page with 35 Info macros on after another = no problem
Create a page with 35 info macros continually nested inside of each other and the page will timeout after 2 minutes trying to save. (Page not found error).

I chose the info macro because it is a very basic Atlassian macro however I've reproduced this with a variety of different macros.
fields.summary: Too many nested macros break page

fields.description:
If you have pages on the same level as the home page, when you open the home page, the page tree on the left side will just show the pages below the home page and won't show any page on the same level as the home page.

However, if you open any other page of the same level as home, it will show all pages of the space, including the home page.

This screenshot shows all pages in the page tree correctly:
!all_page_tree.JPG|thumbnail!

This screenshot shows the incorrect page tree when just the home page is selected:

!Wrong_page_tree.JPG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Page tree doesn't show all pages when you have pages on the same level as the home page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35356].
  {panel}

Currently, blueprint templates can be set Globally or for a specific Space.

However, users might not be aware of this. A tooltip or a String of text of some sort in {{Confluence Admin >> Global Templates and Blueprints}} would be great to let other user's know of the existence of Space specific blueprints.

This is because a Space with multiple administrator could have edited one of the default template and change the look of it and other administrator might not be aware of it.

After that another Space administrator is unaware of this changes might want a different layout and he/she went to Global blueprint to change the default template and Create a page with that particular blueprint on that Space and he/she gets a different result as what he/she have done without being aware that the Global template is actually being overridden by the Space blueprint template. 

This will eliminate that confusion to Confluence administrators.
fields.summary: update string to let users know about the existence of Space specific blueprints
